toc_entry.title: Immigrants
toc_entry.description: From all over the world, people are coming to Houston to find a better life. For a few of them—immigrants from Poland, Nigeria, and El Salvador—this is what it’s like.

toc_entry.title: The Ghost Town
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: The lost hopes of places like Belle Plain haunt Texas’ prairies.

toc_entry.title: The Texas Edison
toc_entry.description: A Dallas engineer you’ve probably never heard of has done more to change our daily lives than almost anyone else alive. How? He invented the silicon chip.

toc_entry.title: The Store That Made Jonesville Famous
toc_entry.description: And other great country stores of Texas.

toc_entry.title: The Man Who Killed Braniff
toc_entry.description: Harding Lawrence was obsessed with making Braniff great. Maybe too obsessed.

toc_entry.title: What Texas Means To Me
toc_entry.description: God created Texas, and then He created people who would love it.

toc_entry.title: Angst Amid the Kiwi Fruit
toc_entry.subtitle: Food
toc_entry.description: Young caterers in Dallas are vying to hire the preppiest staff to serve the spiffiest food at the classiest parties.

toc_entry.title: The Way To A Woman’s Heart
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: Just say these three little words: “Shall we dance?”

toc_entry.title: A Generous Helping
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: Houston’s Stages theater gave new writers a push and established writers a pat when it put on a Texans-only playwrights’ festival.

toc_entry.title: Little Alien Lost
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: No one should pass up a close encounter with E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial. Dead Men Don’t Wear Plaid doesn’t wear well. Conan the Barbarian is nothing but muscle; Annie is nothing but bustle.

toc_entry.title: Contentshe Kid Is Blowing Them Away
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: In the footsteps of Louis Armstrong, Miles Davis, and other trumpet greats comes twenty-year-old Wynton Marsalis. Judging by their latest albums, Herbie Hancock, Ron Carter, and fellow veterans are doing all right too.

toc_entry.title: Main Street Religion
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: The power and charm of the Reverend Charles Allen go beyond his own church, First United Methodist of Houston. Simple, standard churches like First Presbyterian in Brownsville are the solid rock of American religion.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: A job crunch hits Odessa; an all-business mayor shakes up El Paso; the Rangers fold (again); a Houston homeowner wars with his neighborhood association; grads commemorate an all-black high school.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Slums for sale; hardball at the Herald; bye-bye, Nueces Bay; hello, mudslinging.
